dlgLine.text: We ready to fly out yet?

dlgAnsw.text: Anything that would improve your mood?
I have some questions for you.
You took yourself off the assignment board - why?
I need your help today.
I need your help today.
I'm cutting your extra food rations for your own safety.
I found another pilot. I may not need you anymore.
Where should we look for aircraft?
No. We'll talk later.

dlgLine.text: I bet you do.

dlgAnsw.text: Any skills I should know about?
Any ideas on what's going on out there?
Anything I could do to improve this place?
Do you think things will start to get better again?
I'll ask it later. See ya.

dlgLine.text: A man in my profession is expected to posess a wide-range of talents. I mean, being a pilot, that's not even half of the job, usually.

dlgAnsw.text: What profession is that?
Whatever. I have another question...
I've decided I don't care. See ya.

dlgLine.text: Whatever the job calls for... I started out repossessing aircraft. Not difficult, until you've had to take one from a drug dealer or dictator. That led to international contacts and more lucrative offers. Flying out more... valuable cargo.

dlgAnsw.text: Drugs?
Guns?
Celebrities?

dlgLine.text: Drugs? No, not worth the hassle. Too many assholes involved on both sides of the law.
A few... Sometimes to both sides of a conflict. It was all being bankrolled by the US government through shells and go-betweens, so the pay was always good.
I suppose. Kept a shitty band from being stoned to death, evacuated some Hollywood types from their burning mansions.

What I really excel at is getting into and out of places against the odds. Extracting VIPs, recovering sensitive material... I miss the risk, the rush... and the piles of cash, back when that meant something. Oh, how the mighty have fallen.

dlgAnsw.text: Bullshit.
Like a spy?
I had another question.
Okay, I've had my fill of stories. Talk to you later.

dlgLine.text: If you say so. I'd give you a few references, but I don't think they'll be answering their phones right now.

dlgAnsw.text: I had another question.
Right. Talk to you later.

dlgLine.text: The spy game? Fuck those guys. Spend years at a desk until some incompetent up the chain of command takes credit for your work? No thanks. I actually worked for my money... got paid more too.

dlgAnsw.text: I had another question.
Interesting. We'll have to continue this later.

dlgLine.text: I was in Cairo, at the start of the outbreak. I didn't really know what was going on then - had a job to evac a European businessman when they shut down the airport. Thought it was civil unrest, which is good for business usually.

Suddenly, I'm getting requests for extraction everywhere - Greece, Germany, China, Japan, the Caribbean. Then I realized - I was running out of places to land. 'Course it didn't matter. Got shot down crossing the US-Mexico border.

dlgAnsw.text: Is that why you were at that airport?
I had another question.
That's interesting, but I have more pressing things to do - excuse me.

dlgLine.text: No, that plane was a cropduster I borrowed in order to escape the hot zone. It just barely made it to that airfield. The area around Splendid looks empty, but I'm guessing this place was a shithole even before this infection thing started.

dlgAnsw.text: I had another question.
That's all I have time for right now.

dlgLine.text: You've got a lot of frightened primates here, so the last thing you need is divided leadership. Consolidate power. Earn respect if you have to, but don't discount the power of a good bribe.
Oh, and find a source of fresh water on the property - nothing breaks a group faster than drought.

dlgAnsw.text: I had another question.
I'll keep it in mind. Excuse me.

dlgLine.text: The fact that things have gotten this out of control is ludicrous. People have been dying forever at the hands of the living. Suddenly the dead are killing them and NOW they're afraid?
Maybe when the smoke clears, we'll have finally culled the herd of the fearful and stupid. That's my hope, anyhow.

dlgAnsw.text: I have another question...
Something to think about. Excuse me.

dlgLine.text: You're altering our deal. What part of non-negotiable did you not understand?

dlgAnsw.text: People are upset about it. It hurts my authority and endangers you.
Others think you're hoarding food. If desperate, they'll take it by force or worse.
I need a pilot, sure, but I like being a leader better. Our deal is hurting my reputation.

dlgLine.text: What do you propose?

dlgAnsw.text: I'm cutting your fee down to three extra rations.
You start working like everybody else.

dlgLine.text: I don't like this... but given the alternatives, I'll accept your proposal. Now go find something with wings - the sooner I get out of here, the less it eats into my own profit margin.

dlgAnsw.text: Right. See ya.
Believe me, the sooner the better for both of us.

dlgLine.text: Putting myself in danger more often for no gains at all? No, I don't think so. But... if it doesn't eat into my current pay, I'd be willing to go as low as three rations rather than five for a day's work. That's as low as I'll go.

dlgAnsw.text: Deal - three rations per day of work.
I can do that.

dlgLine.text: Fine. And maybe we can go find a plane that works so I can fly myself the hell out of this bargain bin confederacy.

dlgAnsw.text: Right. See ya.
Believe me, the sooner the better for both of us.

dlgLine.text: Oh... right. The redhead. Except, wait- she's a helicopter pilot. No plane experience. How many people do you think you'd get out of here on one chopper? Six? Maybe five with supplies.
With the right plane, I can take anyone and their stuff as far as you want. But you thought of that, right?

dlgAnsw.text: Could you teach her to fly a plane?
You make a point.
And what happens if I find another pilot?

dlgLine.text: Oh, yeah, why don't I just teach my replacement - brilliant idea. If you happen to see a professional plane simulator out there, you let me know.

dlgAnsw.text: <Lloyd crosses his arms and stops talking to you.>

dlgLine.text: I tend to do that.

dlgAnsw.text: <Lloyd crosses his arms and stops talking to you.>

dlgLine.text: I'd concentrate on finding something that can take flight if I were you. Not much good having pilots otherwise, is there?

dlgAnsw.text: <Lloyd crosses his arms and stops talking to you.>

dlgLine.text: Hmm... Major airports are out - too big to get out quickly, too dangerous to approach. You need regional airports or airfields - something out of the way.
I'd estimate we need a large private jet or cargo plane to get people and supplies out. And I'll need to run diagnostics on it before taking her up too.

dlgAnsw.text: Know of any nearby?

dlgLine.text: I'm not familiar with this area, so your guess is as good as mine. I'll let you get on with that.

dlgAnsw.text: I had another question.
Right. See ya.

dlgLine.text: We went over this. If you have something that requires a pilot, I will be in that cockpit in a matter of minutes - I'll even wear the hat. You want me to pitch in for something else, well, that's more than what I signed up for.
It's going to cost you extra.

dlgAnsw.text: How much more?
I can't do that.
People here aren't going to be happy about that.

dlgLine.text: My hazard fee is an extra five rations per day. Or a bag of good coffee. Frankly, I'd rather be dead than wake up without a cup of roasted happy in the morning. And that is non-negotiable.

dlgAnsw.text: Do you have any other useful skills?
Fine. I'm done here.

dlgLine.text: That's fine with me - I'd prefer to stay in and work on my volleyball serve, all the same. But if you're desperate...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Oh, darn. Because I really want them to like me. I'm so very desperate for high-fives and chest bumps... Okay, but seriously-

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Are you seriously asking me that? Look, I know that your world might have been the same old commute, groceries, PTA functions, and Christmas sweaters, but danger is nothing really new to me.
Therefore, in order to survive - and get paid a handsome sum for it - I take risks. And I stack the odds in my favor with a healthy accumulation of skills.
I used to count luck as one of them, but... well, look around - that obviously can't be the case.

dlgAnsw.text: I suppose it's always an option. I'll talk to you if I need anything.
Sounds like bullshit to me. Some of us have to work - excuse me.

dlgLine.text: Can do... for a price.

dlgAnsw.text: Here's five rations of food.
Here's a pound of coffee.
Forget it. I'm not that desperate.

dlgLine.text: Ah, that's a shame.

dlgAnsw.text: I have a question.
Thanks for nothing. Excuse me.

dlgLine.text: Excellent. You've got me for a day. I'd advise you use it wisely.

dlgAnsw.text: Assignments will be on the board. I'll come get you when it's time to go.
Oh, you are so going to earn that. Get your gear and wait for my orders.

dlgLine.text: What is it now - three rations? <Sigh>

dlgAnsw.text: Here's three rations of food.
Here's a pound of coffee.
Forget it.

dlgLine.text: Being anywhere but here... But since that's clearly not an option - I always need coffee. Real coffee - if it looks like a powder, I'm dumping it on the floor. And a good cigar - never know when you need to put an eye out.

dlgAnsw.text: Here's a bag of whole coffee beans.
Here's a cigar.
I'll see what I can find.

dlgLine.text: I swear, if I ever run out of these, I'm flying straight to the nearest coffee plantation and becoming a farmer.

dlgAnsw.text: I know what you mean. Enjoy.
Make it last.

dlgLine.text: I don't really smoke these that often, but sometimes I just need to piss off the right person, you know?

dlgAnsw.text: Uh, sure. Have fun.
You're welcome. See ya.
